item.title: Fómhar
item.description: Fómhar marks the balance of night and day, the autumn equinox. This festival is celebrated on September 22 in the northern hemisphere. The name comes from Middle Irish fogamur‎ (“harvest”) and from Old Irish for autumn. It is a time to mark the start of the harvest season. Associations Symbols: Colors: Herbs and plants: Trees: Links and references
